sub_title:
Chief Enterprise Architect / Information Security Leader - I help organisations design, implement and operate a secure, scalable and future proof IT landscape. 
Available for new opportunities
summary:
Global IT Manager and Principal Architect in Royal Dutch Shell with over 30 years of IT Management experience in complex, global, multi-cultural working environments. I hold advanced degrees in Computer Science (BSc) and IT Management (TU Delft Executive Master) and did post-grad studies in IT Governance and Assurance (Antwerp Management School).

I developed and managed Internet- and eBusiness capabilities, steered development of Corporate IT services for Cloud-based hosting and Big Data / Advanced Analytics. Developed and managed offshore capabilities for IT Security and Regulatory Compliance. Recognised expert in IT Architecture, Application Portfolio Management and Information Security. Experienced in translating emerging technology opportunities and Business Requirements into roadmaps and Strategic IT investment plans. Able to communicate technically complex issues with Business partners. Strong analytical and conceptual thinker firmly rooted in reality, authentic leader and people manager with a proven track record of achieving results.

treasury_media.title: MBTI Personality Profile: INTJ (“The Architect”)
treasury_media.description: It’s lonely at the top, and being one of the rarest and most strategically capable personality types, INTJs know this all too well. INTJs form just two percent of the population, and women of this personality type are especially rare, forming just...

education.field_of_study: IT Governance, Business/IT Architecture, Financials, Strategic Sourcing, IT Delivery and Innovation

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

awards.title: CIO award for "Improve Cash and Margin"​
awards.description: Successful migration of business critical payment system that manages payments worth billions of dollars to a suitable SaaS environment, saving Shell $3.5 million over the next 5 years.

awards.title: CIO award for "Contributions to Application Portfolio Management"​
awards.description: Thank you for your hard work on the APM initiative. You have provided a significant foundation of knowledge used both in the current APM exercise and in the expected annual refreshes, and have built alignment into our portfolio roadmaps and expected cost savings over the next four years. We recognize your hard work in the short time frame and great work in leading the natural teams through to delivery for the data quality we see now. Your leadership in preparing the portfolio reviews is greatly appreciated. Well done, keep up the good work and pull those cost levers!

awards.title: CIO award for "Contribution to FileNet Upgrade Program"​
awards.description: Thank you for your significant contributions to the successful delivery of the FileNet Upgrade Program. As one of the CIO's Top-10 Projects launched in 2010/2011, this program was the most complex FileNet upgrade to date in Shell and delivered without any interruption to the business or the external customers who access through multiple connected applications. FileNet as a Business Critical Prime application is connected to 15 production SAP systems and 9 legacy SAP systems across DS, G&P, SGS, and HR, and grows at over 200,000 documents per day. As part of the global FileNet Project Team, our team spread across 14 countries, across Shell, IBM, T-Systems, AT&T, and 3rd party vendors. We entered new service developments with our ISP's, upgraded multiple software and hardware components, migrated 162 million documents, and created a custom DR solution. As we continue in Phase 4, thank you for all your hard work and dedication to make this program a true success.

certifications.name: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) training

profile_positions.description: We engineer tomorrow to build a better future. With leading application know-how, and sustainable innovation, we set out to become our customers’ preferred decarbonization partner, with a focus on long-term value creation for our customers and employees.
profile_positions.title: Lead Architect

profile_positions.description:
Accountability: 
Provide specialist IRM consultancy and services to Shell’s non-operated ventures (NOVs) and non-integrated companies (NICs) to improve their Information Security and Cyber defence capabilities and reduce the risk to Shell in the areas of Information Risk Management, Cyber Security and Process Control Domain Integrity. Service provision includes security maturity assessments (against e.g. ISO27001/27002 or NIST), advise on security strategies, providing industry threat intelligence and vulnerability information, advise on risk remediation activities, help designing and implementing controls or providing resources for IRM staff/capability augmentation.
profile_positions.title: Director IRM Consultancy Services for JV's

profile_positions.description:
ACCOUNTABILITIES:
1)	Drive the development of the overall Shell Global Function (GF) Architecture “Big Picture”.
2)	Steer (global) business change and process improvement through digitisation programs.
3)	Maintain Architecture Governance through the ARB (as chair and decision executive) and in this role drive and steer the IT Architecture for a $100 mln project budget.
4)	Represent GF Architecture interests on Enterprise level in the Architecture Leadership Team (ALT).
5)	Drive key Strategic Architecture choices via the Segment Architectures of all Global Functions (Finance, HR, IT4IT, Real Estate, Corporate Communications, Legal and IRM/IAM).
6)	Strategic Portfolio Management: Drive and steer Project Delivery to ensure portfolio roadmaps are in place and used. Engagement with key suppliers on strategic product roadmaps.
7)	Enable and support Digitalisation  (e.g. Digital Employee Experience) and migrate legacy solutions to Cloud/SaaS services, including the implementation of Robotics (RPA), SalesForce Service Cloud, Workday & HCM for HR, ServiceNow for IT4IT and Concur for Finance & Travel, S4HANA Cloud & EPM and eGRC for Finance, Ping and Saviynt for IAM.
8)	Deliver through the Segment Architects, Solution Architecture for all deployments into GF and ensure Architecture deliverables are in place for the relevant projects.
9)	Drive improvement in the Architecture delivery, governance and assurance processes and tools.
10)	Ensure Architecture artifact quality to standards and principles in appropriate tools, e.g. ServiceNow, Enterprise Architecture Repository, System Architect, etc.
11)	IRM Accountabilities: Ensure that information risks are an integral part of architecture decision making and specifically compliance with GDPR/AVG coming in to force.
profile_positions.title: Chief Architect Shell Global Functions

profile_positions.description:
ACCOUNTABILITIES:
1) Strategy: Develop Architecture Roadmaps for IT4IT and steer Roadmaps of other portfolio's (HR, Finance, Real Estate, Legal, Corporate Communications, IRM).
2) Implementation: Enable and support projects to improve Digital Employee Experience and migrate legacy solutions to Cloud/SaaS services, specifically the implementation of Robotics (RPA), SalesForce Service Cloud, Workday & HCM for HR, ServiceNow for IT4IT and Concur for Finance & Travel.
3) Sourcing Strategy: Build Solution Architecture capability in NL, UK, US and Bangalore, select and hand-over to a newly hired Lead Solution Architect.
4) Solution Architecture: Coach, mentor, support and steer Solution Architects, assign capacity across projects, chair the Architecture Review Board. 
5) Ways of working: Implement new Operating Model and behaviours in Architecture Team. Define and operationalise Agile Architecture to support Agile projects.
6) Contribute to the further enhancement of standards like the IT4IT Reference Architecture, owned by The Open Group.
profile_positions.title: Principal Architect Group Functions / Lead Solution Architect

profile_positions.description:
ACCOUNTABILITIES:
1) Develop and maintain the Segment (read target) Architecture for Finance and MI.
2) Support, steer and drive Finance digitisation and automation projects from IT perspective.
3) Maintain an overview of all projects planned for Finance and MI and ensure these align with the target architecture.
4) Align solution component selection and solution designs for projects within the Segment Architecture.
5) Manage Solution Architecture delivery of projects Finance and Contracting and Procurement.
6) Ensure supplier input and capabilities are fully exploited to further develop the use of deployed IT solutions in Shell.
7) Ensure suppliers are aware of the Shell requirements in areas of specific Shell interest. Influence suppliers to reflect these Shell requirements in their product and service development.
8) Ensure operational issues with an architecture root cause get resolved.
9) Act as primary Strategy, Planning and Architecture contact for the Finance and C&P Business Interface and Delivery Manager.

DIMENSIONS:
1) Shell Global Functions and Enterprise Services as organisational domain
2) Finance, Contracting and Procurrment, Pensions and Enterprise Reporting Services as functional domains.
3) Architecture investment scope is around $60mlm per year not including base-load spend.
4) Stakeholder network includes EVP level stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Lead Architect Shell Group Finance and MI

profile_positions.description:
Position description: 
1) Overall responsibility for definition and maintenance of the Global Alternative Energy/Chemicals/Downstream Functions (AE/CH/DSF) Application Portfolio and Application Roadmaps, driving future Investment Plans, ensuring that the target portfolio is aligned with Business needs and supplier capabilities. The Portfolio Manager defines the target portfolio together with key stakeholders and works with project teams to define and agree country-specific deployments plans.
2) Overall responsibility for all aspects of AE/CH/DSF IT Architecture. This includes (a) the definition of Business specific Reference Architecture, (b) the development of solution design/architecture as well as (c) the assurance of solution architectures against prevailing principles and standards. In this role the challenge is to ensure that the constituent Architecture components (Application, Data, Integration, Infrastructure) as well as Security, Supportability and affordability of the solutions are aligned, documented, compliant with standards and clearly communicated to the IT and Business community.

The project slate in my scope totals over USD 100 million annually. The scope of delivery and assurance includes Procurement, Finance, MI + Master Data Management, HR, HSSE, ERP's, IT for IT services, Chemicals, Alternative Energies and Mergers and Acquisitions.

In this role I am also a member if the Competitive Intelligence Community and maintain relationships with the Academic community, Industry professionals and Research providers to monitor for and respond to potential industry disruptors.
profile_positions.title: Global App Portfolio Mgr & Chief Architect Alternative Energy/Chemicals/Downstream Functions

profile_positions.description:
Manage Delivery of end-to-end support for Business Apps to the Exploration and Production (EP or Upstream) community. Global App Support Mgr has single point accountability for the EP Application Support services globally:

1. Global Application Support Service Delivery, primarily sourced from India/Malaysia.
2. Representation of EP in several Group Service Forums
3. As SOx 404 Global Process Owner accountable for compliance of EP with SOx C11.
4. Own and propagate in EP Support Functional Excellence (ITIL) and as part of this role lead/chair the EP Service Approval Board.
5. Responsibility for Software License Compliance of Business Apps
6. Relationship - and Contract Management for the App Support services with Third Party suppliers such as Wipro.

Dimensions:
- Budget: 25M$ per annum.
- Direct reports: 10 staff
- Indirect reports: approx 20 staff
- Staff under contracts: approx. 200 staff offshore.
- Number of applications in EP is 1600 of which approx. 100 under global support in 2007.
profile_positions.title: Global Application Support Manager Upstream International

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
1. Setup an organisation capable to deliver an Operational Information Security service in accordance with specified requirements.
2. Provision of clear Service Acceptance Criteria. Work with the Transition Manager to on-board the ISIP deliverables in accordance with existing ITDS standards and best practices.
3. Work with the ISIP programme Manager, ISIP work stream leads and Transition Manager to help define the Service Portfolio.
4. Work with the major stakeholders to clarify scope, interfaces and work to minimise overlaps between SecOps and existing service lines
5. Translate the Service Portfolio into job profiles and on the basis of those profiles recruit staff to resource the service team.
6. Develop and implement financial pre-requisites to run the services, in accordance with current Finance and Tax guidelines.
7. Deliver this service until the role of Global Information Security Operations Manager is permanently resourced.
profile_positions.title: Global Information Security Operations Manager (interim)

profile_positions.description:
DIMENSIONS:
1. Direct control over USD 10M-15M per annum. Number of staff is 50+.
2. Direct influence over nature and lifecycle of all service in portfolio. Active participation is expected in the area of Service Management.
3. Some of these solutions are business critical. Responsible for [1] over 200 Web servers (AIX, SUN, NT4 and W2K) and [2] about 500 databases on different platform on about 150-200 servers.
4. Web and Database services are fundamental to the businesses. Objective is to improve service delivery to meet the business needs and to deliver a market conform service in terms of pricing and quality.
5. Adherence to Information Security practices in general and Group Security requirements in particular require special attention, balancing the need for Information Security and the ability/cost to deliver.
6. Balance the usage of new and immature technology with the requirement for high-availability.
profile_positions.title: Web & Database Service Delivery Manager EU/A

profile_positions.description:
I was responsible for the delivery of Web and Internet infrastructure services to customers within and outside Shell, focussed on EU/A. The challenge in this role was to build a team of globally focused service professionals which, despite of continuously increasing demand and immature technology, delivers high quality services to very demanding customers whilst maintaining an acceptable level of profitability and market conformity. Since I am leading this service the team has grown from 3 to about 30+ staff and the turnover quadrupled in less than four years to over NLG 20 million.

My day-to-day activities include lead, develop and coach staff and team managers, business development, service and cost management, project management for high profile projects, infrastructure design, development of new services, SLA's with other internal teams, maintain relationships with external providers, recruitment of new staff, etc.
profile_positions.title: Web Services Manager EU/A

profile_positions.description:
- Leading Office service support in Shell EP Research and Technology Services
- Support/operations/design/development of the RTS Office Systems infrastructure and services
- Management of projects in the Office Systems and Network environment. One of the last projects I managed/help implement was the implementation of a Winframe/Ntrigue based Office systems service for UNIX based customers.
profile_positions.title: Project manager/IT consultant

profile_positions.description:
- Ensuring and assisting with daily operations and support of the PC/network environment (1000+ PCs and heavily segmented Ethernet/Fibre based network).
- Ensuring proper system management and upgrades of the Novell/Office systems environment, the LAN and central printing facilities.
- Contribute to section management; work plans, budget accountabilities, report and to ensure a sound team spirit and safe/secure work environment
- Supervision of 6+ staff.
profile_positions.title: Head Office Systems/Networking
